title: Economy flights, staff bonuses and balking at a £40 Dover sole: meet the husband and wife team who saved Thomas Cook
text:
Since announcing the acquisition of failed travel agent Thomas Cook – and the rescue plan of hundreds of shops and staff – John and Irene Hays have been inundated with emails.

Most are from well-wishers, thanking the husband and wife team behind Hays Travel for saving the livelihoods of so many. But there have also been thousands of messages from luxury companies that cater to the whims of the super-rich offering the pair innumerable ways in which to celebrate their takeover. Their favourite so far is the purchase of a private jet.

“It would never happen,” exclaims Irene, the 65-year-old non-executive chairman of the board of the Sunderland-based firm. They prefer to fly EasyJet from nearby Newcastle...
